main event: Multiple unidentified flying objects were reported in Monbridge, South Carolina on various dates in 1954, exhibiting erratic movement and bright, rainbow-colored lights. The sightings were witnessed by both military personnel and civilians, and the objects were described as bright, glowing, and triangular or round in shape.
interesting points: The objects were observed moving at irregular intervals at various speeds, from as fast as 600 knots to as slow as 120 knots, with sudden changes in speed and direction.
One report described the object as a white, rainbow-colored light with erratic zig-zag motion, flying at an estimated height of 1000-2000 feet.
Several reports mentioned the absence of typical features of meteors, leading to skepticism about the explanation of these sightings as astronomical: meteor.
The witnesses included military captain USAF A-237475, as well as civilian observers from Raleigh, N.C. and Florence, S.C.
Despite skepticism from some officers, the belief that the sightings were unlikely to be explained was also noted in the report.
sighted object: multiple unidentified flying objects with bright, rainbow-colored lights
